sen.j: 神札は、神名や神社名・天照皇大神宮（アマテラスこうたいじんぐう）また神を象徴する物を紙、木札、御神砂、御神水、金属片などに記したものである。
sen.e: Shinmyo or a shrine name, Amaterasu-kotaijingu Shrine, or what represents a deity is written on or infused in a paper, a wooden plate, osuna (sacred sand), goshinsui (sacred water), or a metal piece.

sen.j: 通常、年末に神社が頒布（神宮大麻、氏神大麻、竈荒神札、大歳神様、戸口･柱･天井の関札など）し、各家庭で神棚に納める。
sen.e: Around the end of the year, shrines usually distribute Shinsatsu (such as Jingu taima (Shrine amulet), Ujigami-taima, Kamado-kojin-fuda, Otoshi-no-kamisama, sekifuda (paper charm) for a door, pillar or ceiling) so that each home places it on the household Shinto altar or put on the gate or pillar.

sen.j: 一年の家内安全・無病息災などを祈る。
sen.e: People keep it for praying for safety of the family and state of perfect health over the year.
